channel.title: S&p500 on Archive 03
channel.description: Recent content in S&p500 on Archive 03

item.title: Is the Fed's Rate Cut Really Good News for the Stock Market?
item.description: Three characters clash over the impact of the U.S. Federal Reserve’s interest rate cut on the market. Kurumi predicts a bull market, cheering for a liquidity party, while Mikael strongly warns it’s a precursor to a recession. We analyze the two faces of rate cuts through historical data and explore the wise stance investors should take.

item.title: S&P 500 Hits All-Time High: What Does It Mean?
item.description: The S&P 500 has soared past 6,100 to a new record. Kurumi cheers for the dual engines of AI-driven earnings and easing geopolitical risks, while Mikael warns of Dot-com bubble valuations and ‘Extreme Greed.’ Is it time to hit the accelerator, or should you be looking for the emergency exit?

item.title: The Case for S&P 500 ETFs for Beginners
item.description: Feeling lost about where to start with investing? Even Warren Buffett recommends S&P 500 ETFs. From the true meaning of ‘buy the market’ to the risks of high valuations, three unique characters will explain the fundamentals of investing in a clear and simple way.
